STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 3, 2025
Sarah Codere
U.P. KIDS
57 HURON ST,
HOUGHTON, MI, 49931-2167
Re: License #: CB310282171
Dear Ms. Codere:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
10/02/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI 48684
231-383-5531
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or parents and the foster
parents in the development of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the child and the parents' and
the foster parent's role in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-agency treatment plan with
the parent or parents and foster parents. The agency must inform the parent
or parents and foster parent that the information in the parent-agency
treatment plan and any other information about the child and the child's family
is confidential.
Three of five files reviewed contained one or more PATP's that had late signatures.
One of the three files contained two PATP's where signatures were missing.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
• (2) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster child, and the foster
parent, if applicable, in the child's placement at least once every month.
One of five files reviewed documented the worker visited the child on 8-10-25 and 8-
20-25, however, there was no narrative describing the visits.
2

CPA Rule 400.12422 Foster care case record
• (3) The record must contain all the following information:
(g) A photograph taken at least annually.
One of five files reviewed did not document an updated photo annually.
Repeat Violation:
2024 Renewal, Cap approved 9-16-2024
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency was informed DCWL is no longer auditing any DHHS Policy.
DCWL Consultants will only be auditing rules described in the "Licensing
Rules For Child Placing Agencies" rule book”.
• The agency was also informed that a social work contact documenting the
foster care worker reviewed the PATP with the foster parent and other
relevant parties and provided them with a copy of the treatment plan would
meet the rule when obtaining signatures was not possible.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: An
approved CAP was submitted on 9-16-2024 in response to those violations
established during the renewal inspection completed on 8-26-2024. The violations
were as follows:
R 400.12311 Foster parent/agency agreement.
R 400.12312 Foster Parent Training.
R 400.12422 Foster Care Case Record.
R 400.12418 Development of Service Plans.
R 400.12510 Independent Living Agreement.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meetings
3

FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans.
FOM 801-03 Medical Passport.
The current interim inspection established a repeat violation of R 400.12422
Foster Care Case Record. There were no other repeat violations indicating the
agency CAP was successful in preventing other repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators report was reviewed. The assessment addressed the
CAP from the renewal inspection and efforts to maintain corrective action. No
barriers were noted. There were no unplanned discharges, however the
assessment discussed the process for this should a case present itself. Efforts to
preserve a placement were discussed.
Financial Overview
Financial records were reviewed including an annual budget and a certified public
accountant audit of the agency. There were no concerns noted.
Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed reported enjoying working for the agency. One staff stated
working with the team is her favorite part of working for the agency. She reported
the team is supportive and enjoyable to work with. Staff reported they feel
supported by their supervisors and that supervision is knowledgeable.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern, well maintained building in downtown
Houghton. There is sufficient office space, a conference room, areas for visitation
and a lobby. CHRI documents were observed to be secured.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst generated two safety alerts during her visits to the homes They are
as follows:
Safety Alert # 1. A safety alert was generated on 8-12-2025 as the foster home did not
have a smoke alarm between the child's bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 8-13-2025 as the alarm was installed and
photos provided.
Safety Alert # 2. A safety alert was generated on 8-13-2025 as the home was lacking a
smoke alarm between the far basement bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 8-15-2025 as the alarm was installed and
photos provided.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended the agency continue on their regular license.
October 2, 2025
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
10/3/2025
